CatDescriptText: Louis Goldman, high school graduate, Duquesne, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "That is wrong, to talk to him. I would just shoot him because I don't think that he's right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Louis Goldman wearing dark diagonally striped tie and light colored overcoat with top buttons unfastened, posed in front of store with advertisements for dog food, Downtown
